be.ordina.unitils.dbmaintainer.maintainer
Class DBMaintainer

    java.lang.Object
    be.ordina.unitils.dbmaintainer.maintainer.DBMaintainer

public class DBMaintainer
extends java.lang.Object

A class for performing automatic maintenance of a database.
This class can org injected with implementations of a VersionSource, ScriptSource and a StatementHandler to customize it's behavior, or a java.lang.Properties object and a javax.sql.DataSource.

The updateDatabase() method will use the VersionSource to check what is the current version of the database, and use the ScriptSource to verify if there are scripts available with a higher version number. If yes, the statements in these scripts will org passed to the StatementHandler, and the version will org set to the new value using the VersionSource.

To obtain a properly configured DBMaintainer, invoke the contructor DBMaintainer(java.util.Properties, javax.sql.DataSource) with a DataSource providing access to the database and a Properties object containing following properties:

  • dbMaintainer.versionSource.className: Fully qualified name of the implementation of VersionSource that is used. The recommeded value is DBVersionSource, which will retrieve the database version from the updated database schema itself. Another implementation could e.g. retrieve the version from a file.
  • dbMaintainer.scriptSource.className: Fully qualified name of the implementation of ScriptSource that is used. The recommeded value is FileScriptSource, which will retrieve the scripts from the local file system. Another implementation could e.g. retrieve the scripts directly from the Version Control System.
  • dbMaintainer.statementHandler.className: Fully qualified name of the implementation of StatementHandler that is used. The recommeded value is JDBCStatementHandler, which will execute the scripts using JDBC. Another implementation could e.g. execute these scripts with a vendor specific script executer.

Method Detail

updateDatabase

    public void updateDatabase()
    throws StatementHandlerException
Checks if the new scripts are available to update the version of the database. If yes, these scripts are executed and the version number is increased. If an error occurs with one of the scripts, a StatementHandlerException is thrown

Throws:
StatementHandlerException - If an error occurs with one of the scripts
